understanding_cycles_detail: The menstrual cycle averages 28 days but can vary from 21-35 days. Understanding phases helps you provide better support.
communication_detail: Ask how they're feeling and what they need. Don't assume - everyone's experience is different.
practical_support_detail: Help with chores, bring comfort items, prepare meals, or simply be present.
emotional_support_detail: Listen without judgment. Validate feelings. Small gestures of kindness matter.
what_not_to_do_detail: Avoid dismissing pain, making jokes about mood, or saying 'is it that time of the month?'
symptom_education_detail: Cramps, fatigue, mood changes, headaches are normal. Severe pain isn't - encourage medical consultation.
phase_menstrual_tip: Menstrual Phase: Offer rest, comfort items, gentle support
phase_follicular_tip: Follicular Phase: Energy rising, great for activities together
phase_ovulation_tip: Ovulation Phase: Peak energy, confidence high
phase_luteal_tip: Luteal Phase: Energy may vary, be flexible
phase_pms_tip: PMS Phase: Extra patience, avoid conflicts, kind gestures
privacy_respect_detail: Your partner chose what to share. Respect their boundaries and privacy choices.
emergency_signs_detail: Severe pain, heavy bleeding, fever, or symptoms interfering with daily life warrant medical attention.
be_proactive_detail: Stock comfort items, know their preferences, anticipate needs without being asked.
